questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

A company uses Dynamics 365 Customer Insights.

For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
it seems they all should be "YES" 

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-insights/data/data-unification-merge-tables

First one is Application bc an application in Dynamics 365 or other CRM systems allows users to view customer information from different areas, providing a unified view of customer data across various sources and interactions.
Session: The correct answer! A session allows users to access and view customer information across various areas within Dynamics 365.
Do not understand why Session for the first question - Session is for various Customers; I would think you would use different Applications to view Customer records

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

A company uses Omnichannel for Dynamics 365 Customer Service.

You need to train a new employee on Omnichannel features.

Match each feature to its definition.

To answer, drag the appropriate feature from the column on the left to its definition on the right. Each feature may be used once, more than once, or not at all. Each correct match is worth one point.

//IMG//

choices.A: Converting work orders to knowledge articles

questions.question_text:
You are evaluating Dynamics 365 Customer Service for a company.

A company executive needs to understand which knowledge management features are available.

You need to describe the features.

Which three features should you describe?

Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

HOTSPOT
-

You are configuring Dynamics 365 Remote Assist to use with Dynamics 365 Field Service.

For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

comments.content: Wrong because CAll Logs is different from a link recording.

discussion.content:
First one should be no. Call recordings are automatically uploaded to OneDrive for business, not automatically available on the record.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/mixed-reality/remote-assist/mobile-app/call-recording

While Remote Assist itself may not automatically log call details to the support record, it can integrate with Dynamics 365 Field Service to facilitate a more seamless workflow.

In such integrations, the process might involve the technician using Remote Assist to collaborate with experts and resolve issues. The technician can then manually update the support record within Dynamics 365 Field Service, logging details about the assistance provided, actions taken, and any relevant information.
I believe it records that a call was made though, so it logs a call

comments.content:
Dynamics 365 Remote Assist primarily focuses on providing real-time remote collaboration capabilities, allowing users to share their view, receive guidance, and collaborate on solving problems. However, features related to tracking and displaying trends in types of calls or remote assistance sessions might not be a core functionality of Dynamics 365 Remote Assist itself.

To track trends and analytics related to the types of calls or remote assistance sessions, organizations often leverage additional tools or analytics platforms. Integration with analytics tools or reporting modules can provide insights into usage patterns, common issues addressed, and other relevant metrics.
So, Y, Y, N

questions.question_text:
A company uses Dynamics 365 Field Service.

A technician needs to create a checklist to determine the work that needs to be performed for a work order.

You need to create the checklist.

Which tool should you use?
